result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T Gales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Michael T Gales was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael T Gales is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Michael T Gales was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reporter: Heather Kieta
Day 2 of trial; courtroom without jury panel present; Atty Raymond advised she believed the Defendant had violated the sequestration order by having phone contact with a witness; as a remedy Atty Raymond requested witness not be allowed to testify; witness was sworn and examined by the Court and counsel; Court ruled it would allow the witness to testify; Court conducted colloquy with Defendant regarding his decision to testify; jury panel present in courtroom; Defendant's case - testimony taken; Defendant rested; jury panel removed from courtroom; jury instruction conference on the record; jury panel present in courtroom; State advised it would not be presenting rebuttal evidence; final jury instructions given by Court; closing argument by counsel; rebuttal argument by Atty Wetjen for the State; Juror 9 chosen as the alternate juror and excused; Court continued giving final jury instructions; bailiff sworn by clerk; jury removed for deliberations; Court reconvened with jury panel present; presiding juror advised they had reached a verdict; Court read verdicts into the record; Count 1 - Not Guilty; Count 2 - Not Guilty; Count 3 - Guilty; Court polled jurors individually; closing instructions were given by the Court and the jury was excused; Atty Raymond moved for judgment on Count 3; Atty Makovec moved for a judgment of acquittal on Counts 1 and 2; Court entered judgment of not guilty on Counts 1 and 2 and guilty on Count 3; Atty Raymond moved to revoke bail; Atty Makovec moved Court to set a signature bond on Count 3; argument of counsel; Court set bond in the amount of $1,000 cash for the case with previously bail conditions as set remaining the same
Preliminary

Reporter: Heather Kieta - a.m.
                  Linda Flakne - p.m.
Day 1 of trial; Courtroom without jury panel present; counsel approved preliminary jury instructions; Court and counsel agreed upon number of prior convictions for Defendant and witnesses for impeachment purposes; jury panel present in courtroom and sworn by clerk; preliminary instructions given by Court; opening statements by counsel; State's evidence - testimony and exhibits; State rested; Atty Makovec moved for judgment of acquittal; Court denied motion

Reporter: Lori Gerlach
Transcript of Initial Appearance held on April 15, 2014 filed.

Ctrm without jury panel present; court ruled on motions in limine filed by counsel.  Judge orders all witness excluded from courtroom wtih exception of Detective Tye.  Motion in Limine 2a regarding character of witness submitted by Atty Makovec was withdrawn. Jurors present at 9:45 am.  Introduction by ct.  Prospective panel sworn by clerk.  23 prospective jurors chosen.  Jurors 1-23 seated; ct questioned panel; juror 1 excused by ct at 10:00 am and replaced with juror 24.  Juror 8 and 13 excused by ct at 10:11 am and replaced by jurors 21 and 27.  Voir Dire by counsel; voir dire concluded; jurors not seated excused; No Batson objections; 13 jurors chosen for final panel.  All jurors not chosen excused at 10:55 am. Court admonished jurors and instructed jury to report back on Wed. at 9:00 am. Impaneling concludes at 10:57 am.  Jury panel excused at 10:57 am
